TITLE: Chelsea takeover: Todd Boehly consortium signs agreement to take over from Roman Abramovich
SUMMARY: Todd Boehly's consortium has signed an agreement to purchase Chelsea from Roman Abramovich.

TITLE: CDC investigating 109 cases of severe hepatitis in kids across two dozen states, including 5 deaths
SUMMARY: The cases of severe hepatitis have been found across 25 states and territories.

TITLE: China to ban minors from tipping livestreamers, watching after 10 p.m.
SUMMARY: China's broadcasting regulator on Saturday put forward new rules that bar minors from tipping livestreamers and also require online platforms to prevent such users from watching livestreaming services after 10 p.m.

TITLE: How a trip to rural Zambia, backed by U2 singer Bono, led Matt Damon to campaign for clean water
SUMMARY: The Oscar-winning actor, producer and screenwriter co-founded nonprofit Water.org in 2009.

TITLE: 'We are nowhere near the bottom,' top economist says as global markets crater
SUMMARY: Stock markets are set for more heavy selling this summer as central banks around the world hike interest rates to fight spiraling inflation, said one economist.

TITLE: Cramer’s week ahead: Own recession-proof names and have cash ready for when stocks ‘come roaring back’
SUMMARY: "Your portfolio should be split among some cash and some stocks that can thrive in a recession," the "Mad Money" host said.

TITLE: All-out war on Ukraine? Putin could be gearing up for something big on May 9
SUMMARY: "Victory Day" is a key day for Russia as it marks the anniversary of the then-Soviet Union's defeat of Nazi Germany.

TITLE: Stocks could see more tumult next week, especially if bond yields continue to scream higher
SUMMARY: After a week of extraordinary turbulence, stocks are likely to remain volatile as investors await fresh data on inflation and watch the course of bond yields.

TITLE: In the Philippines, presidential frontrunner Bongbong seeks to rebrand Marcos' brutal legacy
SUMMARY: The son of late dictator Ferdinand Marcos is the frontrunner in opinion polls and is favored reclaim the presidency for the Marcos family.

TITLE: Stocks fall on Friday to close out tumultuous week, Dow drops for sixth straight week
SUMMARY: The moves came after stocks sold off sharply in Thursday's session.

TITLE: U.S.-listed Chinese EV maker Nio proposes a secondary listing of its shares in Singapore
SUMMARY: The move comes as Nio and dozens of other U.S.-listed Chinese companies face a possible delisting from American exchanges.

TITLE: Ice cream freezers to get 'warmed up' in trial by Ben & Jerry's owner
SUMMARY: The company is eyeing pilot schemes in Germany and Indonesia.

TITLE: Nvidia didn't tell investors enough about effects of crypto mining on its business, SEC says
SUMMARY: In 2017, ETH rose from $10 to $800, driving demand for Nvidia graphics cards.

TITLE: Italy freezes superyacht reportedly linked to Russian President Vladimir Putin
'Pass the damn bill:' Biden demands chips legislation to counter China tech rise
SUMMARY: President Biden urged Congress to take swift action on the Bipartisan Innovation Act, a multibillion-dollar investment in the U.S. semiconductor industry.

TITLE: Biden announces up to $150 million Ukraine military aid package as fears of Russian escalation grow
SUMMARY: Biden's latest military aid package is the ninth U.S. security assistance installment since Moscow invaded its neighbor in late February.

TITLE: 'We see a big recession in the making': Top CEOs are fearing the worst in Europe
SUMMARY: The CEOs of several European blue chip companies have told CNBC that they see a significant recession coming down the pike in Europe.

TITLE: Boris Johnson's Conservatives suffer losses in UK local elections, amid scandal and cost-of-living crisis
SUMMARY: The U.K.'s ruling Conservative Party has lost a slew of seats in local elections across England, dealing a potential blow to embattled Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

TITLE: Elon Musk denies claim by Truth Social boss that Trump encouraged him to buy Twitter
SUMMARY: Devin Nunes, head of Donald Trump's social media company, told Fox Business News that the ex-president urged Tesla chief Elon Musk to buy Twitter.

TITLE: Google is raising pay, revamping employee reviews, documents show
SUMMARY: Google is making changes to its performance evaluation and promotions process, which will result in higher salaries, executives said.

TITLE: European stocks close 1.6% lower as investors fret over rate hikes, surging inflation
SUMMARY: European markets retreated on Friday, tracking global caution after Wall Street posted its worst day since 2020.

TITLE: Payroll growth accelerated by 428,000 in April, more than expected as jobs picture stays strong
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls grew by 428,000 for the month, a bit above the Dow Jones estimate of 400,000. The unemployment rate was 3.6%.

TITLE: Scientists are hoping to grow coral reefs at the base of wind turbines in Taiwan
SUMMARY: The planet's reefs face a number of threats, including coral bleaching.

TITLE: Bitcoin drops below $36,000 amid broader market sell-off
SUMMARY: Bitcoin cratered this week as a major stock sell-off in the U.S. stock market spooked the cryptocurrency market.

TITLE: Used-car prices are down from record highs, easing the impact of inflation
SUMMARY: Wholesale vehicle prices have dropped 6.4% since the January record.

TITLE: ECB member pushes for quick move to raise rates, says Russia-Ukraine war could derail recovery
SUMMARY: The European Central Bank should move quickly to raise interest rates in order to tackle soaring inflation, according to Finland's central bank chief.

TITLE: Bank of England chief defends cautious rate hiking cycle, sees unprecedented shock to people's income
SUMMARY: The BOE is tasked with steering the economy through an inflation surge that has been exacerbated by Russia's unprovoked onslaught in Ukraine.

TITLE: Hong Kong's Hang Seng index drops more than 3% following Wall Street tumble
SUMMARY: Shares on Wall Street declined sharply overnight, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average seeing its worst day since 2020.

TITLE: As the Philippine election draws near, China-friendly Marcos still retains a wide lead
SUMMARY: With just days to go before the Philippine elections, Ferdinand Marcos Jr. continues to retain a big lead over his closest rival — the country's current Vice President Leni Robredo.

TITLE: Longtime China bull Stephen Roach says there's 'no way' Beijing will meet its 5.5% growth target
SUMMARY: Beijing has officially set a growth target of around 5.5% for the Chinese economy this year, but economist Stephen Roach says "it will be lucky if it makes 4."
